Found something what 'solved' the DEP issue in Vista:

"To stop the DEP protection, launch an elevated command prompt shell with administrative priviledges and credentials (log on to Windows Vista with a user account with administrator rights, and then right click on Command Prompt icon and select ?Run as Administrator, or turn off UAC). Then execute the following command:

bcdedit.exe /set {current} nx AlwaysOff

If you regret your decision and now wants to enable or turn back on the DEP protection for your Windows Vista, simply use the following command instead:

bcdedit.exe /set {current} nx AlwaysOn"

I use Vista, and this game did not work when I first installed it, however I looked into all of the issues this game has with vista and rest assured, it is NOT the torrent. Here are all of the problems I researched and how to fix it to make this very torrent work with Vista:

First and foremost, the crack in this torrent DOES NOT WORK!  DO NOT USE IT!  Instead, download the unprotected exe onthis page.  It's the VERY FIRST link under the category "Game Fixes". 

If that doesn't work, you may be getting a DEP (Data Execution Prevention) error message.  If this is the case, simply click Start, and in the "Start Search" box, type "sysdm.cpl" (without quotes).  You'll get vista's vastly obnoxious "Windows needs your permission to continue" window. Click Continue, then click the Advanced tab, then click "Settings..." under Performance, click on the radio button that states "Turn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select:", click "Add...", and find your newly UNprotected copy of Thief3 aptly called "t3.exe". 

If that doesn't work, you may have a compatibility issue.  This one is easy: simply right-click t3.exe in it's install directory, click Properties, click Compatibility, and click the check box stating "Run this program in compatibility mode for:", select from the drop-down menu "Windows XP (Service Pack 2)".

If even THAT doesn't work, sometimes Thief 3 has DirectX issues.  You can solve this by installing DirectX 9c directly from Microsoft (this requires an ActiveX control Microsoft will install to see if your copy of Vista is genuine, so be careful you dirty pirates you!).  If you are indeed a dirty pirate with an rather UN-genuine version of Vista, you can download the cab files for DirectX 9c here but I warn you, there is NO INSTALLATION WIZARD!!! You will need to copy these cab files manually to your system32 directory. 

DON'T WORRY!! YOU WILL STILL HAVE DIRECTX 10!  DIRECTX DOES NOT COPY OVER ITSELF!!  INSTALLING DIRECTX 9 WILL SIMPLY ADD MISSING FILES DIRECTX 10 DOES NOT HAVE!!!  YOU CAN HAVE BOTH AT THE SAME TIME WITHOUT A PROBLEM!!!

If that doesn't work, pick up a book on how to use your computer, because this is as far as I go.  But I PROMISE YOU!!!  To protect RAZOR1911's rep, this torrent is 100% WORKING AND OPERABLE!!!  IT'S THE GAME THAT HAPPENS TO BE A LITTLE FAULTY!!

Happy Leeching you n00bs,


HybridMoments82

ok i found a fix! the game does not like  most dual core cpu like AMD Athlon 64 X2 or an Intel Pentium "D" so the fix is to set Thief III to use only one core. This can be accomplished by entering the Processes tab of the Task Manager when the game is running, right clicking each of the Thief III-releated processes (T3Main.exe, T3.exe), selecting "Affinity" and unchecking one of the CPUs. ps you have to do this every time you start the game.
